summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Untouchables: Season 2, Vol. 1
Review Date: 2014/03/16
Store: Abel Fernandez  (Actor),     Paul Picerni  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Paramount Home Entertainment, Drama
Product Description: ['Product Description', 'Robert Stack, Nicholas Georgiade. Hot shot Treasury agent Eliot Ness and his squad of untouchables" continue to put the kabosh on Al Capone and his organized crime empire during 1930s Chicago. Includes Jack \'Legs\' Diamond" (10/20/60), Kiss of Death Girl" (12/8/60) and 14 more from the first 16 episodes of the second season on 4 DVDs. 1960-61/b&w/13 hrs., 26 min/NR/fullscreen.', 'Amazon.com', 'In Billy Wilder\x92s classic,', 'The Apartment', ', a sleazy corporate exec tries to schedule an after-hours tryst with one of the company\x92s switchboard operators. "Thursday?" she protests. "But that\x92s', 'The Untouchables', 'with Bob Stack." "So we\x92ll watch it at the apartment," the exec placates her. "Big deal." As Wilder\x92s shout-out indicates,', 'The Untouchables', 'was a big deal. Hot off Robert Stack\x92s Emmy-winning performance as Treasury Agent Elliot Ness,', 'The Untouchables', 'blasted its way into the Nielsen Top Ten in its second season, which begins in a blaze of glory with the episode, "The Rusty Heller Story," featuring Elizabeth Montgomery in her Emmy-nominated role as the "no good" showgirl who plays two mobsters and a corrupt lawyer against each other (', 'Bewitched', 'fans will note that the lawyer with whom she gets very chummy is portrayed by David White, the future Larry Tate!). More than four decades later, with its film noir sensibility, smart-writing, hard-boiled dialogue, and plenty of what Rusty Heller calls, "boom-boom action,"', 'The Untouchables', 'is still as potent (but not as deadly) as a bottle of ginger jake. The 16 episodes contained on this four-disc set tell some great (albeit suspect) stories of the kingpins, criminals, and hoodlums who thought they had "the guts" to move in on Al Capone\x92s tottering empire. Among the most arresting are "The Big Train," a gripping two-parter featuring Neville Brand reprising his role as Capone, who plots his escape while en route to Alcatraz, "Jamaica Ginger," featuring James Coburn and Brian Keith as a couple of "torpedoes" hired by a gangster to kill his rival, a plan complicated when one falls in love with a schoolteacher, and "The Purple Gang," about Detroit\x92s feared gang that kidnaps an underling (Werner "Colonel Klink" Klemperer) with Capone ties. Joining Ness\x92s incorruptible squad this season is Paul Picerni as Agent Lee Hobson, but it\x92s Stack\x92s show all the way. He gets to slap wiseguys around ("Answer the question, punk") and deliver the best lines. When one goon tells him he has no respect for the dead, Ness replies, "Sometimes, even less for the living." His relentless war against the underworld sometimes comes at a terrible price. When one innocent woman is gunned down, the killers taunt, "Satisfied, Mr. Ness?" But, of course, that just steels his resolve. As for this set, we\x92re satisfied, even without any bonus features, and the now common (and criminal) practice of season splitting.', '--Donald Liebenson']
Average Rating: 4.7
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Action & Adventure/Television, Television/Crime', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Black & White', 'Contributor': 'Bruce Gordon, Abel Fernandez, Anthony George, Robert Stack, Paul Picerni, Nicholas Georgiade', 'Language': 'Unqualified, English (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono), Spanish (Dolby Digital 2.0 Mono)', 'Number Of Discs': '4', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 0.01 Ounces', 'Item model number': '131944', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, NTSC, Black & White', 'Run time': '13 hours and 26 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 4, 2015', 'Actors': 'Abel Fernandez, Paul Picerni, Anthony George, Bruce Gordon, Robert Stack', 'Subtitles': 'English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Paramount Pictures Home Entertainment', 'Number of discs': '4'}

raw_response:
SUMMARY:  
The individual demonstrates a strong preference for drama and crime genres, particularly enjoying classic and engaging narratives that prioritize character depth and storytelling. They consistently rate products highly, with several 4.5-star and 5.0-star ratings indicating a desire for quality entertainment and appreciation for well-crafted productions. Notably, they show a tendency to purchase media as gifts, highlighting a social aspect to their shopping behavior.  

The consumer appears to be moderately price-sensitive, favoring products with good perceived value but not hesitating to spend on higher-rated selections. The reviews reflect a clear inclination towards content that is entertaining and keeps their interest, while they express dissatisfaction with movies they find boring or lacking engagement.  

Regarding family influence, the consumer also purchases children's media, suggesting a preference for family-friendly films that children enjoy. This implies valuing content that fosters shared viewing experiences. overall, their core preferences lean towards quality drama and engaging storylines, with a notable appreciation for films that are suitable for both personal enjoyment and gifting.
